column4: How do I remove flash or shockwave from my firefox? Its not listed in Add-Ons
yeah
thanks
Seem to be having "issues". I run, in a terminal, nm-applet, and it starts the little thing in my notification area. The moment I quit the terminal, so does the little thing. Why is this?
Whenever you run an applet in the terminal, it dies out with the terminal.
You can get around this by putting the process in the background...
how?
Try pressing Ctrl + z, (puts process in suspended state) and then typing "bg"

I have a simple shell script to do that though, when I want to start a program like that I make a script in /usr/bin that goes something along the lines of "/usr/bin/programtorun &" where the & puts it in the background
so what exactly do I type? nm-applet bg?
No, more like "nm-applet &", or "nm-applet", then "ctrl+z" and then type "bg"
I remember seeing something about the Alacarte Menu Editor...
it says "Alacarte is now only available as a part of the GNOME desktop, beginning with GNOME 2.16."
Are you on KDE?
Im on gnome
So you don't have the menu editor installed?
You should just be able to press "Alt-F2" and type in "alacarte"
well I do, but I dont want to edit the menus, I want to make it so where Appplications, Places, and Systems arent there, just the ubuntu logo
Right click the ubuntu thing, click remove. Then right click, hit "Add", and sellect "Main Menu"
thanks :)
No problem :D
I bet you get a kick out of helping noobs :p
Haha. You could say that. I just like Ubuntu so much :D
